subsc: Flood protection,Roads and highways,Health,Primary education,Irrigation and drainage

abstracts.cdata!:
The 1992 Flood Damage Restoration
            Project's main objective objective is to assist the
            government in implementing a national program to restore
            vital infrastructure destroyed or damaged in the 1992 flood
            in order to minimize the disruption to economic activity and
            social services.  A sectoral approach to project design has
            been adopted in order to respond flexibly and efficiently to
            the country's needs.  The project will also accelerate
            the start of selected top priority works to protect
            investments in infrastructure that survived the 1992 flood.
            The project covers:  (a) repair and restoration of federal
            and provincial infrastructure, including roads and bridges,
            irrigation, drainage and flood protection works, and primary
            education and basic health facilities; and (b) restoration
            of infrastructure mainly provided by government enterprises
            such as railways, power, and telecommunications.
